definitions.definition: the act of committing a serious crime such as murder or rape; a crime of this type

examples.text: He was charged with felony assault.
a felony punishable by up to six years in prison
He was indicted on three felony charges of lying to the grand jury.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French felonie, from felon ‘wicked, a wicked person’ (oblique case of fel ‘evil’), from medieval Latin fello, fellon-, of unknown origin.
